intro: Reediella samoensis, commonly known as the Samoan reed, is a flowering plant native to the island of Savai'i in Samoa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, inconspicuous flowers arranged in spikelets. It typically grows in wet, marshy areas and is adapted to the humid tropical climate of its native habitat. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species within its region.
